snippet: Microsoft's decision to move its European logistics and distribution headquarters to the Netherlands from Germany has generated a debate over patent law in Germany, where it is easy to block the sale of a rival's product even before an infringement...
abstract: Microsoft's decision to move its European logistics and distribution headquarters to the Netherlands from Germany has generated a debate over patent law in Germany, where it is easy to block the sale of a rival's product even before an infringement claim is verified, reports Kevin J. O'Brien in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: German Courts at Epicenter of Global Patent Battles
